attributes.action: Increase animal cruelty charges, make specific offences for attacks on pets
attributes.additional_details:
Currently the sentence for for the injury or death of a "domestic animal" if not owned by the defendant is criminal damage as they are classed as property that is capable of being "damaged or destroyed"

Currently the maximum sentence for animal cruelty is 51 weeks however in practice this is often not applied.

Animal cruelty cases are considered summary offences, with magistrates’ courts only permitted to sentence people to a maximum of six months jail time.
attributes.background:
The petition wants to see higher penalties for animal neglect, cruelty, attacks on domestic pets, and specific offences created for attacks/abuse on domestic pets

Our pets are not property they are family

Our pets look after us and protect us. The least we can do is the same for them
